image.altText: Nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has told his Coalition colleagues he will go to the next election promising to build seven nuclear power stations.

title.children: Muja near Collie among seven sites revealed by Dutton for proposed nuclear power plants

image.altText: A close up shot of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: Nuclear power plants would be built at seven locations in five states under the opposition's nuclear policy, the opposition leader confirms. Follow live.

title.children: Peter Dutton addressing media over Coalition's nuclear policy, confirms proposed sites

image.altText: Kylie dancing with a graphic saying 'how much money my online business made in a week'.

props.synopsis: Women in regional Australia are being funnelled into a multi-level marketing scheme promising a "multiple-six-figure business online" â€” but the "freedom" they seek comes at a cost.

title.children: Thousands of people are being funnelled into a multi-level marketing scheme promising 'financial freedom', but there's a cost

image.altText: Cherie Finnerty, domestic violence survivor, No Limits Perth volunteer  2024-06-18

props.synopsis: Women escaping domestic violence often find themselves homeless, and the organisations assisting them are under increasing strain. This survivor is now returning the favour, volunteering for an organisation that once helped her.Â

title.children: Cherie's car became her haven as she escaped domestic violence. Now she's helping others break free

image.altText: Two black and white images show a young Anthony Albanese and Tony Abbott

props.synopsis: Democracy is built on the right of citizens to voice dissent. A glance at the history of our political leaders' involvement with student protests perhaps goes some way to explaining the response to the pro-Palestine movement on campuses today.

title.children: Two political events unfolding before our eyes this week tell us a story about democracy, and our own leaders

image.altText: siblings with lambs

props.synopsis: A statewide feed shortage, off the back of a brutally dry summer, is seeing an increasing number of sheep orphaned across the state's farming regions.

title.children: These jumper-clad rescued lambs highlight a deeper issue facing WA farmers

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu chairs the weekly cabinet meeting.

props.synopsis: The October 7 attacks united many Israeli politicians and citizens in grief and anger but, after eight months of war, that has changed and right-wing voices now have a larger seat at Benjamin Netanyahu's table.

title.children: Israel's war-time unity is gone, as the region teeters on the brink of another major conflict

image.altText: HMAS Stalwart berths at the newly built Kuru wharf at HMAS Coonawarra in Darwin, NT.

props.synopsis: Australia's newest warship is undergoing emergency mechanical repairs to address "engine defects", at the same time the navy's only other supply class vessel remains out of service.

title.children: Australia's newest warship breaks down, undergoing emergency mechanical repairs after just 3 years of service

image.altText: a split image showing a child riding on the new BMX track and it later covered in weeds

props.synopsis: Last year, Halls Creek Shire and the WA government spruiked the town's new BMX track as an exciting way to engage troubled youth. Now residents are asking why it's overgrown with weeds and practically unusable.

title.children: Residents fume after weeds take over remote BMX track built to steer children away from crime

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses speaks in front of a media wall that says "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Pressure is growing on the Reserve Bank to lift interest rates again as inflation remains stubbornly high, but governor Michele Bullock knows another rate hike all but guarantees a recession.

title.children: 'It's a challenging time': RBA boss Bullock shoots straight on her interest rate dilemma

image.altText: Justin Timberlake in front of a grey background.

props.synopsis: Boy band singer-turned-solo star and actor Justin Timberlake has been arrested and charged with a drink-driving offence, according to New York law enforcement officials.Â

title.children: Singer Justin Timberlake arrested and charged with driving while intoxicated

image.altText: Footballer Cristiano Ronaldo yelling on the pitch, pointing his index fingers to the ground

props.synopsis: There are two new contenders for goal of the tournament after the overnight Euro 2024 games, and fans have been drenched by a leaking stadium. Here are the five quick hits.

title.children: Euro 2024 five quick hits: Turkish teen produces wonder strike, Ronaldo makes history again, and fans engage in 'food wars'

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress speaks at a press conference outside a court building

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison may be among those called to give evidence at the defamation trial Senator Linda Reynolds has brought against former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins, a Perth court is told.

title.children: Scott Morrison revealed as witness in Linda Reynolds's defamation case against Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis:
The ACCC is wary about the proposed merger of Chemist Warehouse and Sigma Healthcare. But other decisions will matter more for service and prices. They concern pharmacy discounting and location rules, and they'll involve taking on existing owners.


Â

title.children: Why pharmacies could be teetering on an 'Uber' moment

image.altText: Cold winter in Canberra 2015

props.synopsis: Winter solstice is only a few days away. Here's when and what you can expect from the "shortest day of the year".

title.children: We're about to start getting more daylight hours. Here's why

image.altText: The back of a women looking down a dark hallway in shadows

props.synopsis: Women who have left financially abusive situations can be saddled with massive debts they never incurred and advocates say the ATO is often unsympathetic in their pursuit of those funds.

title.children: Abusive partners using tax system as 'weapon'

image.altText: Tennis player Alex de Minaur returns serve with a forehand, wearing a cap on his head, on a grass court

props.synopsis: Less than 48 hours after celebrating an impressive tournament win in the Netherlands, Alex de Minaur has had to rewrite his plans for Wimbledon after suffering an upset loss at Queen's.

title.children: 'I think I got unlucky': De Minaur suffers shock loss ahead of Wimbledon

image.altText: Dane Swan

props.synopsis: As Pies champ Dane Swan is inducted into the Hall of Fame, he admits he did not deserve to be on an AFL list early in his career due to poor off-field behaviour.Â

title.children: 'I didn't deserve to be on an AFL list': Pies champ admits early career issues as he joins Hall of Fame

image.altText: Two men and a woman stand confidently in front of a blue curtain

props.synopsis: Get your buzzers ready, music fans â€” it's Spicks and Specks trivia time!

title.children: How well do you know music lyrics? This Spicks and Specks music quiz will put you to the test

image.altText: A corner shot of a building with a green eye logo and the word NVIDIA displayed in grey.

props.synopsis: Technology multinational Nvidia has become the world's most valuable company, dethroning tech heavyweight Microsoft as its high-end processors play a central role in a scramble to dominate artificial intelligence computing.

title.children: Nvidia becomes world's most valuable company on back of demand for AI

image.altText: The front gate of a medium security prison.

props.synopsis: A report from the Office of the Inspector of Custodial Services has revealed declining satisfaction among both inmates and staff at Bunbury Regional Prison, and called for a review of its management, infrastructure and mental health services.

title.children: Watchdog finds WA's largest regional prison under increasing strain

image.altText: A man in a suit named Li Qiang waves before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: Pandas might have dominated the headlines when the Chinese Premier visited South Australia, but the only other state Li Qiang is visiting has bigger ambitions â€” and its all about mining.

title.children: Forget wine and pandas, it's all about rocks and minerals as China premier heads west

image.altText: A dusting of snow covers the rocks at cradle mountain

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia have woken to their coldest morning of the year over the last two days, and the 'feels-like' temperature has been even more chilly. Here's why.

title.children: Icy blast adds extra chill to Australia's east as BOM reveals 'feels-like' temperature formula

image.altText: A dog in a cage with sad eyes

props.synopsis: Letters obtained by the ABC show Moreton Bay council officers did not have the proper authorisations to order fines, euthanasias and impoundments for dangerous dogs.

title.children: Council unlawfully seized dogs and fined owners for eight years, leaked documents show

image.altText: Three writers - Celeste Ng, Paul Lynch and Christos Tsiolkas- pink background

props.synopsis: The 2023 Booker Prize winner Paul Lynch and bestselling authors Celeste Ng and Christos Tsiolkas reveal the secrets of their reading and writing lives.

title.children: Three of the world's best authors on when they know it's time to give up writing a book

image.altText: Michael, Rose and Orlyn at the graveside of their mother, Constance Watcho.

props.synopsis: After 87 submissions and many traumatic stories shared by First Nations advocates and families across five states and territories, the last hearing has been held in Melbourne. But there are concerns it will not lead to effective action.

title.children: Calls for further action after Senate inquiry into missing and murdered First Nations women and children

image.altText: Amal Ein Alshaiba poses for a photo standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: A survey of immigrant community leaders suggests their members are being hit harder than the wider community by the cost-of-living crisis, but also that they are showing resilience and helping each other.

title.children: As costs have risen, Amal found a solution in her kitchen

image.altText: Forensic police and uniformed officers kneel to examine material in a large bowl.

props.synopsis: Forensic testing will be done to determine whether the bones found on a Coffs Harbour beach are human.

title.children: Suspected human remains found at NSW beach

image.altText: A close-up of a man's hands holding a power bill.

props.synopsis: A higher-than-expected bill is enough to give most people a sinking feeling â€” especially if you don't think it's fair. Here's a breakdown of your rights and how to dispute a bill.

title.children: Think you've been overcharged for electricity? Here's what to do if your bill doesn't look right

image.altText: A manÂ looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are likely to edge lower as the market opens the day after the Reserve Bank kept interest rates on hold at a 12-year-high. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX to slip the day after interest rates decision, Nvidia overtakes Microsoft on value

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in North Korea for his first visit in 24 years, vowing to deepen trade and security ties with the reclusive nuclear-armed state.

title.children: Putin promises to back North Korea in support against US during visit

image.altText: A firefighter in a yellow jacket and red helmet stands with back to camera among scrub, looking at burning tree

props.synopsis: New research suggests the world's climate change authority has underestimated the severity of future bushfires in Australia.

title.children: IPCC says bushfires will burn longer and more often. A new study points to an even worse outlook
